page.title: 03Garvald Footpaths
page.content: The favourite village walk known as the Three Bridges, is down the glen of the Papana. An old bridle road leads past the church. The glen is wooded with sycamores, elms, beeches and larches. There are three foot bridges over the burn where trout dart over the deep pools; moorhens, dippers & mallard breed, a profusions of wild flowers and berries for picking. A ruined cornmill hides in the gorge over which the ancient peel tower of Stoneypath still dominates. The monks generously allow the residents to walk in the beautiful grounds of Nunraw which are planted with rare trees & masses of daffodils & narcissi. Behind the old house is the ancient Nun's walk along the edge of a deep wooded sandstone cleuch, where it is common to disturb deer. Paths across the open farm land lead to the Donely Reservoir
